page.title: 01Castle Kennedy and Surrounds
page.content: This area is mainly farmland. There are some crops but most land is used for grazing for cattle. Dairy farming is predominant but there is some beef farming.The bulk of the land in this section is owned by Lord Stair.There is one village,Castle Kennedy.There are few amenities.People in the village generally use Stranraer,three miles away,for shopping, banking, doctors, etc. The main tourist attraction is Castle Kennedy Gardens. There is a small Primary School of about 50 pupils and 3 teachers. At the last census the village population was 314. The A75 Euro-route runs through this section.There are buses to Dumfries and London as well as the main railway line between Stranraer and Glasgow/London. This is definitely a country area.
